introduction:

vocabulary.definition: A person who freely offers to take part in an enterprise or undertake a task.
vocabulary.example: She decided to volunteer at the local animal shelter over the weekend.

vocabulary.definition: To emphasize the profitable aspects of something, especially at the expense of quality or sincerity.
vocabulary.example: The holiday has become so commercialized that the true meaning is often overshadowed by sales and promotions.

vocabulary.definition: A scene, especially a painting, of the birth of Jesus in Bethlehem.
vocabulary.example: During Christmas, many families set up a nativity scene in their homes to remember the story of Jesus' birth.

vocabulary.definition: The action or process of making changes in something, especially an institution or practice.
vocabulary.example: The reformation of the education system led to improved teaching methods and curriculum.

vocabulary.definition: The basic cause, source, or origin of something.
vocabulary.example: The traditions of Christmas have their roots in various cultures and historical events.

vocabulary.definition: To explain the meaning of something or to understand something in a particular way.
vocabulary.example: Different cultures interpret the symbols of Christmas in unique ways, reflecting their own traditions.
